Bo Sony v prihodnje sploh še nadaljeval z razvojem pametnih telefonov?

01 Nov 2019, 06:06

Poslovanje japonskega podjetja Sony na splošno ni slabo, vendar pa je oddelek za mobilno telefonijo dosegel rezultate daleč pod pričakovanji. V tretjem četrtletju letošnjega leta so pri Sonyju namreč uspeli prodati zgolj 600 tisoč pametnih telefonov. Prodajne številne so se v primerjavi s prvim letošnjim četrtletjem še poslabšale, saj je na začetku leta japonskemu gigantu vseeno uspelo prodati slab milijon pametnih mobilnih telefonov Android.
Edina dobra novica je, da podjetje vseeno posluje z dobičkom, kar pomeni, da se po vsej verjetnosti ne bo še kar takoj umaknilo iz trga pametnih telefonov. Podjetje Sony sicer lahko pred porazom reši pametni mobilni telefon Sony Xperia 1, ki je med uporabniki še vedno zelo priljubljen. Tu seveda ne smemo pozabiti na pametni mobilni telefon Sony Xperia 5, ki je bil javnosti predstavljen septembra letos in zanimanje zanj počasi, a vztrajno narašča.
Dejstvo pa je, da je prodaja pametnih mobilnih telefonov Sony v primerjavi z njegovimi drugimi izdelki bolj kot ne porazna. Med julijem in septembrom letos je podejtje Sony poleg omenjenega števila pametnih telefonov namreč prodal še 700 tisoč videokamer, 2,5 milijonov običajnih in pametnih televizorjev ter kar 2,8 milijonov igralnih konzol PlayStation 4.



Povezave: Sony Mobile
text:
Will Sony continue to develop smartphones in the future?

01 Nov 2019, 06:06

Sony's business in general is not bad in Japan, but the mobile division has achieved results far below expectations. In the third quarter of this year, Sony managed to sell only 600,000 smartphones. Sales numbers have deteriorated compared to the first quarter of this year, as the Japanese giant managed to sell a million million Android smartphones earlier this year.
The only good news is that the company is still making a profit, which means that it is not likely that it will immediately withdraw from the smartphone market. Sony may save the Sony Xperia 1 smartphone, which is still very popular with consumers, before being defeated. Of course, we should not forget the Sony Xperia 5 smartphone, which was introduced to the public in September this year and is slowly but steadily growing in interest.
The fact is, however, that Sony's smartphone sales are more than unmatched in comparison to its other products. Between July and September this year, in addition to the aforementioned number of smartphones, Sony also sold 700,000 camcorders, 2.5 million regular and smart TVs, and 2.8 million PlayStation 4 game consoles.
